instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message:
No green light with this board.
I have replaced bad C7771

Board looks very nice and clean!

PPBUS_G3H 8.4V
PP3V42_G3H 3.41V

ISL6258
14 ACOK 3.2V
2 DCIN 16.5V
3 ACIN 3.95V

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: Did it have a green light before messing with C7771?

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: No, it had not.

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: C7771 was 0.3 volt before replace. Now it's 1.1 volt.

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: Usually fried Q6910 and U6915, happens if you don't line up the magsafe correctly with it out of the case. Check voltage on pin 5 of U6915

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: pin 5 u6915 0volt

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: it boots when battery is plugged in. I have five 820-2327 boards that acts exactly the same way, works with battery but not with charger

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: Pin 5 should have 18V or so. Check pin 2 of Q6910, it should be 9-13V. If that is ok, replace U6915 and Q6910.

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: Having a hard time finding Q6910. They can be found on 820-2330 and 820-2390. I Don´t have any of these boards. Need to order from ebay and wait 30 days.

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: You can use a NTZD3152 for testing. It's a bit at it's limit as it is rated for 20V.

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message:
Ok, thanks.
I have a couple 820-2879 boards but I don't want to steal anything from them until I tried to fix them.
I will probably spend a lot of time at this place, reading threads and learn troubleshoting

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message:
Does any of these two components, Q6910 and U6915, work without the other. It's always a risk when you take anything from a donor board that the component doesn't work. 

Do I get 9-13volt on pin 2 of Q6910 if U6915 is bad?
Do I get 18 volt on pin 5 of U6915 if Q6910 is bad?

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: Replace them together to avoid wasted time. It is U6915 that shorts and then kills Q6910.

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message:
got U6915 and Q6910 today. Replaced both but still no green light.
pin 5 u6915 0volt

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: Voltage on R6910?

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message:
Pin 1 voltage is changing between 16.71v and 16.85v
Pin 2 voltage is changing between 15.97v and 16.09v
Pin 6 0volt

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: I asked R6910...

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: sorry, R6910 is 3.24 volt

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: ok, voltage on pin 2 of Q6910?

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message:
Q6910
Pin 1 voltage is changing between 16.71v and 16.85v
Pin 2 voltage is changing between 15.97v and 16.09v
Pin 6 0volt

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: Hmm, almost there. What is on pin 6 of Q6915, it must be low.

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message:
Q6915
pin 2 3.2 volt
the other pins are 0 volt

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message:
If pin 6 on Q6915 is low then pin 2 of Q6910 should have about 8-9V. Check R6911/12 and traces. Could also be a dead Q6910 pulling up the gate. 
Check resistance to GND on pin 6 of Q6910, there could be a short that kills Q6910.

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: pin 6 Q6910 to ground is 114 K

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: So figure out why the gate of Q6910 is not 9V. I cannot help more here I gave you all the hints.

threads.title: Another 820-2610 No green light
threads.message: Yes I will try. Thanks for helping me understand how the old onewire works.
